meanings.definition: An optical instrument designed to make distant objects appear nearer.
meanings.sent1: I used a telescope to see the stars up close.
meanings.sent2: The astronomer peered through the telescope to study the planets.
meanings.sent3: When I looked through the telescope backward, everything seemed tiny!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a telescope, zooming in on every detail.
meanings.sent5: The telescope revealed the hidden beauty of the night sky.

meanings.definition: To collapse or fold in on itself.
meanings.sent1: The old chair began to telescope down as I sat on it.
meanings.sent2: He watched the table telescope into a compact size for storage.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella decided to telescope shut just as it started raining.
meanings.sent4: The collapsing building seemed to telescope into a pile of rubble.
meanings.sent5: The spy's antenna telescope down quickly to avoid detection.
